DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator related to patient determination of eligibility in reference to use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to patient determination of eligibility in reference to use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Chemotherapy, if given, has b
ReferenceDocuments.description: Chemotherapy, if given, has been completed at least 4 weeks prior to randomization

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received Prior Treatment with cytotoxic chemotherapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received Prior Treatment with cytotoxic chemotherapy for the current diagnosis of ALL or any cancer diagnosed previously

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If so, was the therapy completed at least 6 months prior to today's date and is there clear evidence of disease subsequent to such therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient previously been treated with cytotoxic chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior chemotherapy or small molecule inhibitors if >=4 weeks since completion prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Greater than or equal to 4 weeks from prior chemotherapy, small molecule cell cycle inhibitors or other investigational agents (>=6 weeks from nitrosoureas) at the time of registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient previously been treated with pelvic radiation or cytotoxic chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on or will they be on a chemotherapy regimen for a duration of  greater than or equal to 3 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least 4 weeks from last dose of prior chemotherapy or non-antibody immunomodulator therapy with resolution of the acute toxic effects of the therapy. For patients coming off of BRAF inhibitor (e.g., IL-2) or other molecularly targeted therapy, at least 2 weeks since last dose and full recovery from toxicities

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient on or will be on a chemotherapy regimen for a duration of  greater than or equal to 3 months or is on or will be on a chemotherapy regimen for less than 3 months and then proceed to transplant during the study period?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received chemotherapy treatment (for a gynecologic malignancy) prior to consideration of enrollment into this trial and taking the geriatric assessment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least 4 weeks from last dose of prior chemotherapy or immunomodulator therapy with resolution of the acute toxicities. For patients coming off molecularly-targeted therapy, at least 2 weeks since last dose and recovery from laboratory and constitutional toxicities. Patients must meet entry eligibility criteria.

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI142 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of greater than 1 line of administered chemotherapy for metastatic disease and been off chemotherapy for a minimum of 2 weeks?  Prior chemotherapy in the adjuvant setting is allowed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was anthracycline or anthraquinone, aside from doxorubicin, ever given as part of initial or subsequent therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_NRG_ELIG
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received 3-6 months of gemcitabine/cisplatin chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_TEXT_12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received systemic chemotherapy for the study cancer less than 2 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there planned use of cytotoxic chemotherapy during radiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received treatment with any other investigational agent within 4 weeks prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CE7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there a plan for the patient to receive cytotoxic chemotherapy within 48 hours prior or after the SRS or WBRT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed curative chemotherapy within past 6 months at a COG institution?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient completed prior cytotoxic chemotherapy at least 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient participated in a study of an investigational agent and received cancer-directed study therapy within 4 weeks prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was prior adjuvant chemotherapy (e.g., paclitaxel/carboplatin alone or as a component of concurrent chemotherapy and radiation therapy [with or without cisplatin]) completed equal or greater than 12 months prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was prior adjuvant chemotherapy (e.g., paclitaxel/carboplatin alone or as a component of concurrent chemotherapy and radiation therapy [with or without cisplatin]) completed equal or greater than 12 months prior to Step 1 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient complete appropriate institutional neoadjuvant chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text13
ReferenceDocuments.description: was last day of chemotherapy > 21 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-97415
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scheduled to receive chemotherapy

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-1806
ReferenceDocuments.description: Planning to undergo 1st line 5-FU based chemotherapy (as monotherapy [as 5-FU alone or capecitabine] or in combination with oxaliplatin and/or irinotecan +/- biologics).

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any prior systemic chemotherapy, targeted therapy, or immunotherapy; or radiation therapy administered as treatment for colorectal cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text12
ReferenceDocuments.description: was last day of chemotherapy greater than 21 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text11
ReferenceDocuments.description: was last day of chemotherapy >= 21 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed curative therapy (surgery and/or radiation and/or chemotherapy) within past 6 months at a COG institution?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the prior chemotherapy include a first line platinum based regimen with or without consolidation chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI142_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of greater than 1 line of administered chemotherapy for metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient completed all cancer treatment within 3 to 36 calendar months prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient participated in a study of an investigational agent and received cancer-directed study therapy within 4 weeks prior to Step 2 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF97415v2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scheduled to receive chemotherapy and/or estrogen antagonist aromatase inhibitors (anastrozole [Arimidex], letrozole [Femara], exemestane [Aromasin])

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had any prior systemic chemotherapy, targeted therapy, or immunotherapy; or radiation therapy administered as treatment for colorectal cancer (e.g., primary colon adenocarcinomas for which treatment with neoadjuvant chemotherapy and/or radiation is warranted are not permitted)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient completed prior cytotoxic chemotherapy at least 28 days prior to Step 2 registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-106 Amendment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Planning to undergo immunotherapy and/or 5-FU based chemotherapy as first line of treatment.  5-FU chemotherapy can be 5-FU along or in combination with oxaliplatin and/or irinotecan; +/- immunotherapy.  Capecitabine is also acceptable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participants receiving strong or moderate CYP3A inhibitors must agree to discontinue use at least 48 hours prior to start of study treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: No more than 1 line of prior chemotherapy for metastatic or locally advanced disease (neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy will be allowed if given 12 or more months prior to registration).

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the last dose of chemotherapy been administered at least 3 weeks prior to registration (to ensure recovery from nadir period of previous line of therapy)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Received prior chemotherapy for B-cell ALL/LBL

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-1806 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Planning to or recently started to undergo immunotherapy and/or 5-FU based on chemotherapy as first line of treatment.  5-FU chemotherapy can be 5-FU alone or in combination with oxaliplatin and/or irinotecan; plus or minus immunotherapy.  Capecitabine is also acceptable.  If unable to engage patient before treatment starts, enrollment is allowed up to four weeks after the start of treatment but must be before Cycle 2 begins.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received chemotherapy or treatment for a prior malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: No other chemotherapy regimen in locally advanced metastatic setting besides the first line chemotherapy

DataElement.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form
